Hi Artem,

> 1) OnHostDecideRule - to accept anything on same hosts.     
> 2) NotOnHostsDecideRule - to reject anything on not same hosts.     
> 3) OnDomainsDecideRule - to accept anything on same domains.     
> 4) NotOnDomainsDecideRule - to reject anything not on same domains.     

If all 4 rules are using seeds.txt file to create prefixes then you 
don't need rules 1,2 and 4:
	- rule 1 is not needed since rule 3 is broader in scope.
	- rule 2 has no effect since very first rule you have rejects all URIs 
by default (see the order file and RejectDecideRule).
	- rule 4 is not need for same reason as the rule 2.


> Yes, now I save to ARC only html/text files.    
> I'm trying to do: extract only links (from html) to some     
> files (in this case, *.doc and *.ppt) and save only these links to     
> the crawl.log file. 
>   
> In other words, I want to restrict fetching and processing of all  
> URIs that not end with the specified pattern.  


Would this work?

1) reject all URIs by default (RejectDecideRule)
2) accept all URIs within domain (OnDomainsDecideRule)
3) reject all URIs that don't match specified files extension 
(NoMatchesFilePatternDecideRule). If you want only htm(l), docs and ppts 
use '^(?i)^.*\.(?:html?|doc|ppt)$'

Take care,
i.
